title: [Large-Scale] E-Learning Course Development Strategies Using Heuristic Task Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Proficiency in basic e-learning development processes and comprehension of instructional design theories
context.additional_context: Real-time collaboration and project development environment utilizing learners' personal devices (BYOD).

learning_goals: Enhancing the ability to establish step-by-step strategies for language learning e-courses by applying HTA techniques

Over a 6-month long-term course, learners can repeatedly perform a 3-stage improvement cycle (analysis–content development–evaluation design) at least three times using real-world corporate cases through project-based learning (PBL), meet 80% or more of the evaluation rubric criteria for each stage’s deliverables (analysis report, development plan, evaluation results), and demonstrate the improvement process through a final project presentation.
Deriving and applying three or more customized heuristic principles according to institutional contexts
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
